intro: Conobea ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf conobea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Conobea ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
